result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany A Covill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brittany A Covill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brittany A Covill was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan commencing 04/15/16. $15 payment plan fee assessed.

Sentenced to 10 days in Marquette County Jail with huber. 
Report by 4:00 P.M. today clean & sober.
Good Time
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany A Covill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF VIOLATION OF JOC FROM MASO- REPORTED POSITIVE FOR THC

Defendant Brittany A Covill in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant for a pre-trial and an offer was provided.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Defendant agrees.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney and wants to proceed.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee has no objection to the 60 day stay of jail time.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report today by 4:00pm, clean & sober.
Good Time 
Court Costs = $243.00 + $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in April

Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Pre-trial conference at 02-09-2016 09:15 am.
Return date at 03-02-2016 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brittany A Covill in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial  Return date scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 09:15 am.
